description: A brief presentation covering the primary mechanisms for achieving concurrency in Ruby. The differences and similarities of each will be touched on. At the end you may be lucky enough to understand which mechanism to use when (if you do, please be so kind as to explain it to the presenter :) ).
short_description: A brief presentation covering the primary mechanisms for achieving concurrency in Ruby. The differences and similarities of each
title: Subprocesses, Threads and Fibers - Rory McKinley
